item.title: ã»ã¼ã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ³ã‚¯æ‰±ã„ã§è²·ã£ãŸBOSS Dr.Rhythm DR-660ã‚’ä¿®ç†ã™ã‚‹
item.description:
ã‚¢ãƒœã‹ã©ã•ã‚“ã«ã€ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒ•ã‚£ã‚¹ãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—ã§ä½¿ã‚ã‚Œã¦ã„ãŸã‚®ã‚¢ã‚’ç´¹ä»‹ã™ã‚‹è¨˜äº‹ã‚’æ•™ãˆã¦ã‚‚ã‚‰ã£ãŸã€‚

How Memphis Rap Was Produced In The 90s (A Detailed Guide) â€“ Loaded Samples

ãã“ã§BOSSã®ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ—ãªãƒ‰ãƒ©ãƒ ãƒã‚·ãƒ³ã€DR-660ãŒç´¹ä»‹ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ãŸã€‚

The importance of the DR-660 in Memphis Rap cannot be understated. Without this machine there would be no “Phonk” genre. The style of using pitched 808 cowbells was a direct result of unique design limitations on this budget rhythm machine. Original TR-808 machines did not enable you sequence 808 cowbells or kicks at various pitches in a drum pattern, this functionality was exclusive to the DR series drum machines. It’s hard to imagine that Memphis Rap would sound the way it did without the use of the DR-660.

  Serial.begin(31250); // MIDIã®ãƒœãƒ¼ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚’è¨­å®š

  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++){ // ãƒ”ãƒ³ã‚’ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã¨LEDã«å‰²å½“
    pinMode(btn[i], INPUT_PULLUP); // ãƒœã‚¿ãƒ³ã¯å†…éƒ¨ãƒ—ãƒ«ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ä½¿ã†
    pinMode(led[i], OUTPUT);
  }
  digitalWrite(led[ledActive], HIGH); // ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆã®LEDã‚’ç‚¹ç¯

  pinMode(btnDim, INPUT_PULLUP);
  pinMode(ledDim, OUTPUT);
}

void loop() {
  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++){
    if (digitalRead(btn[i]) == LOW) { // ã‚¿ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚¹ã‚¤ãƒƒãƒãŒæŠ¼ã•ã‚ŒãŸå ´åˆ
      delay(50); // ãƒãƒ£ã‚¿ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°é˜²æ­¢

      // MIDIãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã®é€ä¿¡
      noteOn(0, note[i], 64);   // Ch.1, note, vel. 64
      MidiUSB.flush();
      delay(50);
      noteOff(0, note[i], 64);  // Ch.1, note, vel. 64
      MidiUSB.flush();
      delay(50);

      // LEDã®æŒ™å‹•
      digitalWrite(led[ledActive], LOW);
      ledActive = i;
      digitalWrite(led[i], HIGH); // æ–°ã—ã„LEDã‚’ç‚¹ç¯
      while (digitalRead(btn[i]) == LOW) {
        // ã‚¹ã‚¤ãƒƒãƒãŒæŠ¼ã•ã‚ŒãŸã¾ã¾ã®å ´åˆã€å¾…æ©Ÿ
      }
    }
  }

  if (digitalRead(btnDim) == LOW) {
    delay(50); // ãƒãƒ£ã‚¿ãƒªãƒ³ã‚°é˜²æ­¢

    // MIDIãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã®é€ä¿¡
    noteOn(0, noteDim, 64);   // Ch.1, note, vel. 64
    MidiUSB.flush();
    delay(50);
    noteOff(0, noteDim, 64);  // Ch.1, note, vel. 64
    MidiUSB.flush();
    delay(50);

    // LEDã®åˆ¶å¾¡
    isDimOn = !isDimOn;
    digitalWrite(ledDim, isDimOn ? HIGH : LOW);
    while (digitalRead(btnDim) == LOW) {
      // ã‚¹ã‚¤ãƒƒãƒãŒæŠ¼ã•ã‚ŒãŸã¾ã¾ã®å ´åˆã€å¾…æ©Ÿ
    }
  }

}

// ä»¥ä¸‹ã€å¤šåˆ†ãªã‚“ã‹MIDIUSBã®å‹•ä½œã«å¿…è¦ãªã‚„ã¤

void noteOn(byte channel, byte pitch, byte velocity) {
  midiEventPacket_t noteOn = {0x09, 0x90 | channel, pitch, velocity};
  MidiUSB.sendMIDI(noteOn);
}

void noteOff(byte channel, byte pitch, byte velocity) {
  midiEventPacket_t noteOff = {0x08, 0x80 | channel, pitch, velocity};
  MidiUSB.sendMIDI(noteOff);
}

void controlChange(byte channel, byte control, byte value) {
  midiEventPacket_t event = {0x0B, 0xB0 | channel, control, value};
  MidiUSB.sendMIDI(event);
}
